title: Quiz Question 1
content: Where in the nephron does furosemide primarily exert its diuretic effect?
options: Ascending limb of the loop of Henle

title: Quiz Question 2
content: Which ion transporter is primarily inhibited by furosemide in the ascending limb of the loop of Henle?

title: Quiz Question 3
content: What is the primary effect of furosemide's action on ion reabsorption in the ascending limb?
options: Decreases sodium, potassium, and chloride reabsorption
Increases sodium, potassium, and chloride reabsorption
Decreases sodium and potassium reabsorption, increases chloride reabsorption
Increases sodium reabsorption, decreases potassium and chloride
